Hello,

I have tried to use the duplication reduction processors as it is
e=
xplained in  Feature Notes - 1.12.0
(http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/=
display/Heritrix/Feature+Notes+-+1.12.0)

I'm not sure to well understand t=
he detail, in fetcher modules I have
selected the following processors in t=
his order:

____________
Select Fetchers Processors that fetch documents us=
ing various protocols

 org.archive.crawler.processor.recrawl.PersistLoadPr=
ocessor		Down
Remove	Info
 org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchDNS	Up	Down	Rem=
ove	Info
 org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP	Up	Down	Remove	Info
 org.ar=
chive.crawler.processor.recrawl.FetchHistoryProcessor	Up
Down	Remove	Info
 =
org.archive.crawler.processor.recrawl.PersistStoreProcessor	Up	
Remove	Info=

__________

Is it the right place?

Do I need to specify an absolute path =
somewhere to be sure that
heritrix knows where to check if some pages are a=
lready crawled?

Currently with my configuration if I start 3 jobs from the=
 same
profile one after other, I produce 3 arcs files with almost the same
=
size (so without duplication reduction).

Is it better to use the deduplica=
tor add on module with 1.12.1 version
of heritrix?

regards,

Arnaud.
